revised_title: Morphology and Mechanism of Formation of Porous Anodic Films on Aluminium
tldr: The authors studied the morphology of porous anodic films formed on aluminum in phosphoric acid electrolytes. They discovered that the steady-state barrier-layer thickness, cell diameter, and pore diameter are directly proportional to the formation voltage. The mechanism of film formation involves an equilibrium between oxide formation in the barrier layer and field-assisted dissolution at the bases, determining the cell and pore sizes through a simple geometrical mechanism.
